Package Server

Class DBController

java.lang.Object
Server.DBController
public class DBController extends Object
This class is a singleton design pattern which is responsible for connecting to a MySQL database and handle the data operations
Author:
Shadi, Mahran

      ConnectToDB method is used to establish a connection to the MySQL database using the provided credentials
      Parameters:
      UserName - the user name to connect to the database
      Password - the password associated with the user name
      SchemaName - the name of the schema or database to connect to
      Returns:
      messageToReturn a string message indicating the status of the connection attempt

    • CheckLogin

      public ArrayList<Object> CheckLogin(String TableName, String username, String password, int c1, int c2)
      Check login credentials.
      Parameters:
      TableName - the table name
      username - the user name
      password - the user's password
      c1 - the column number for the user name
      c2 - the column number for the password
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Object that contains the login status, and other details about the user if the credentials are correct, otherwise it returns "false" and "null" in the ArrayList

    • GetAllTableData

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> GetAllTableData(int size, String SelectQuery)
      The GetAllTableData method retrieves all the data from a table according to a SELECT query.
      Parameters:
      size - The number of columns of the table
      SelectQuery - SELECT query that will be used to fetch the data from the table
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of ArrayLists of Objects that contains the data of the table

    • ShowWholeTable

      public void ShowWholeTable(String TableName, int size)
      The ShowWholeTable function retrieves all data from the specified table and prints it to the console.
      Parameters:
      TableName - the name of the table whose data needs to be retrieved.
      size - the number of columns in the table.

    • ShowTableRowUsingKey

      public void ShowTableRowUsingKey(String keyName, String key, String TableName, int size)
      ShowTableRowUsingKey This method will take a table name, column name, key value, and size of the table as an input, and it will query the table with the provided key column name and key value and return the resulted row, it will print the data on console.
      Parameters:
      keyName - Column name used as a key to filter data
      key - value to filter data
      TableName - the name of the table to be queried
      size - the number of columns in the table

    • EditTableRow

      public void EditTableRow(String ColumnName, String ToReplace, String Condition, String TableName, int size)
      The method EditTableRow allows you to update a certain value of a certain column in a table based on a specific condition.
      Parameters:
      ColumnName - name of the column you want to update the value of.
      ToReplace - the new value you want to replace the current value with.
      Condition - the condition on which the value will be updated, it should be in the form of 'columnName = columnValue'.
      TableName - name of the table you want to update.
      size - number of columns in the table.

    • DeleteTable

      public void DeleteTable(String TableName)
      This method allows to delete a table in the database.
      Parameters:
      TableName - : The name of the table that you want to delete

    • SelectViewQuery

      public void SelectViewQuery(String Query, int ts)
      This method is used to execute a SELECT statement and display the results on the console. The query to be executed should be passed as the first parameter, and the number of columns in the returned result set should be passed as the second parameter. The results are stored in an ArrayList of ArrayLists and the values are printed on the console.
      Parameters:
      Query - - The SELECT statement to be executed
      ts - - the number of columns in the result set

    • SelectEditQuery

      public void SelectEditQuery(String Query)
      Runs the given query and performs the update operation on the data.
      Parameters:
      Query - The update query string to be executed

    • AddProductToOrder

      public ArrayList<String> AddProductToOrder(int orderNumber, int pId, int quantity)
      Adds a product to an existing order.
      Parameters:
      orderNumber - The number of the order.
      pId - The id of the product to be added to the order.
      quantity - The quantity of the product to be added to the order.
      Returns:

    • DecreaseQuantityForProducts

      public boolean DecreaseQuantityForProducts(ArrayList<String> id, ArrayList<String> quantity)
      Method that decreases the quantity of a set of products based on their id.
      Parameters:
      id - A list of product id's that need to have their quantity decreased
      quantity - A list of quantity values for the corresponding product id's
      Returns:
      boolean returns true if the update is successful, false otherwise.

    • DecreaseQuantityForProducts_in_machines

      public boolean DecreaseQuantityForProducts_in_machines(ArrayList<String> id, ArrayList<String> quantity)
      Decreases quantity for specific products in machines
      Parameters:
      id - a list of product's ID
      quantity - a list of quantity that should be decreased from the products_in_machine table.
      Returns:
      boolean, true if the process is done successfully.

      Returns:
